author: Harriet Torry
title: U.S. Incomes Rose More Than Consumer Spending in February
text:
WASHINGTON—Americans are saving rather than spending their extra dollars from the recent tax overhaul, which likely held back economic growth in the first quarter. 

Consumer spending rose at a muted pace in February for the second month in a row, despite income gains. Personal income, reflecting Americans’ pretax earnings from salaries and investments, rose 0.4% in February. Meanwhile personal-consumption expenditures, a measure of household spending on everything from dishwashers to books, increased at a slower pace, rising...
